title: Integration with https://core.ac.uk/ - the world's largest collection of open access research papers
body:
## Feature Request

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I have started to use ASReview to discover interesting research papers / knowledge about various topics. The problem is that the small, fixed set of data collections it comes with isn't likely to contain what I am looking for

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like there to be a plug-in which allows me to use the CORE API (https://core.ac.uk/services/api/) to create an initial set of papers to review. The API is limited to 10 pages of 100 articles each, so it's important to help the user formulate a query that returns a specific set of results. Also, some filtering of duplicates may be required.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I've built a small script to query the CORE API /article/search and create a .csv file with title, abstract and URL. This works, however the iteration cycle is rather long and cumbersome - it would be nicer to have it integrated as 1 experience

**Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy**
I think most users will naturally understand how to leverage this new source of potential knowledge. I recently discovered CORE after having obtained ASReview and I have no affiliation or know any of their team members, but I suspect they may be interested to collaborate: https://core.ac.uk/about/#team. Both projects seem very much aligned in their philosophy
